Recruiting and retaining the right people is crucial to my business. I look for individuals who are not only skilled but also share my vision and are willing to take risks. I've found that the most effective way to recruit personnel is through word of mouth and referrals from trusted associates. This way, I can vet potential candidates before they even join my organization.

I also use various tactics to attract the right kind of people. For instance, I offer competitive pay and benefits, as well as a sense of excitement and thrill that comes with working in a high-stakes industry. I make sure my team members know that they are part of something big, something that can change their lives forever.

To retain my personnel, I use a combination of rewards and punishments. Those who perform well are rewarded handsomely, with bonuses and other incentives. I also make sure my team members are well taken care of, as long as they remain loyal. I provide them with protection, medical care, and other benefits that they might not be able to get elsewhere. And, of course, I make sure they know that they are part of a family, a family that looks out for each other.

But let's be clear, my business is not for the faint of heart. I deal in a commodity that is highly sought after, and I will stop at nothing to get what I want. My team members know this, and they are expected to be just as ruthless and cunning as I am.

In the end, it's all about results. If you can deliver, you'll be rewarded. If you can't, you're out. It's that simple. And I've found that this approach has been very effective in recruiting and retaining the kind of personnel I need to succeed in this business.
